ProjectTitle: Multiple diagnostics platforms for in situ crystallization studies connected by differential impedance measurements (DIM-C)
InitialFeedbackHistory:
20/01/2025
Data: Please add the samples/materials that you will use in the data table, these are considered physical data in the context of a DMP, also describe how you document, store, preserve and share them in the subsequent questions.
Documentation: Please focus here on how you will document your data, e.g using protocols, readme files, lab notebooks, etc; data sharing will be addressed in a 5th topic of the DMP. 
Storage: Please describe which storage solution you will use, the storage guide can help you choose: https://icts.kuleuven.be/storagewijzer/en
Preservation/storage: Do you have a specific reason to use Harvard Dataverse? If not, please consider using KU Leuven RDR (https://rdr.kuleuven.be/) instead, RDR stores the data on the KU Leuven servers, has a detailed guide: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr and in house support making it a more user friendly option for researchers at KU Leuven
label: good with suggestions
